tune/song/CL:支[zhi1]
high/tall/above average/loud/your (honorific)
surname Gao
and/together with/with/sum/union/peace/harmony/Taiwan pr. [han4] when it means "and" or "with"
surname He/Japanese (food, clothes etc)
to combine a powdery substance (flour, plaster etc) with water/Taiwan pr. [huo4]
to complete a set in mahjong or playing cards
to compose a poem in reply (to sb's poem) using the same rhyme sequence/to join in the singing/to chime in with others

sentences.english: Betting against the Aussie has been a loner's game for the past few years.
sentences.chinese: 看空澳元在過去幾年一直“曲高和寡”。

sentences.english: You thought that you are too cultured to be appreciated by the masses, is actually is incompatible with the environment.
sentences.chinese: 你以爲自己是曲高和寡，其實是與環境格格不入吧。

sentences.english: Lose public support this matter, if stem of good, call a song Gao with few.
sentences.chinese: 不得人心這事，如果幹的好，叫曲高和寡。

sentences.english: There are great works of art that are appreciated by a limited audience.
sentences.chinese: 偉大的藝術作品往往曲高和寡。

sentences.english: Unfortunately, not every visitor would enjoy this contemplative drama of aesthetic.
sentences.chinese: 曲高和寡，並非人人都欣賞這齣無言的美學劇。

definition: melodies of the elite in the state of Chu 楚國|楚国[Chu3 guo2]/highbrow art and literature
folk songs of the state of Chu 楚國|楚国[Chu3 guo2]/popular art forms (cf. 陽春白雪|阳春白雪[yang2 chun1 bai2 xue3], highbrow art forms)
lone flower admiring itself (idiom); narcissism/self-love
can be enjoyed by scholars and lay-people alike (idiom)
to pick up what others say (idiom); to pass off other people's opinions as one's own/to parrot

vulgar/tacky/tawdry
to cater to the public's taste/kitsch/commercial
mass-oriented/to cater for the masses/popularized
(of an uneducated person) to mingle with the cognoscenti/to pose as a culture lover/to be a culture snob/having pretensions to culture
common people/laity (i.e. not priests)
lit. Dong Shi imitates Xi Shi's frown (idiom)/fig. to mimick sb's idiosyncrasies but make a fool of oneself
prevalent fashion (often used pejoratively)/vulgar customs
to moan about imaginary illness/fussing like a hypochondriac/fig. sentimental nonsense
proletariat/abbr. for 普羅列塔利亞|普罗列塔利亚[pu3 luo2 lie4 ta3 li4 ya4] plus masses/also written 無產階級|无产阶级[wu2 chan3 jie1 ji2] in PRC Marxist theory
